business.headline: Why Indians still prefer buying homes during auspicious monthsBuying a home in India is more than just a financial decision — it is an emotional milestone. For many, choosing the right time to invest is as important as picking the right property, with festivals and auspicious dates playing a big role.

Crypto crash wipes out $19 billion after Trump's 100% China tariffs spark sell-offThe cryptocurrency market suffered a historic crash after US President Donald Trump announced 100% tariffs on China and new export controls on software.

Crisis brews at Bira 91: How a name change shook the popular beer brandFrom beer icon to regulatory nightmare, Bira 91's journey shows how a minor administrative tweak can spiral into financial chaos, employee unrest, and investor anxiety.

LG Electronics vs Tata Capital IPO: What should be your strategy post-listing?Two IPOs, two very different strategies. Tata Capital offers steady long-term growth, while LG Electronics promises quick listing gains. Read on to plan post-listing moves and investment approach carefully.

LG Electronics IPO allotment is finally out. How much listing gain you can expect?Investors who received allotments may be sitting on potential listing gains of Rs 5,000–Rs 6,000 per lot, depending on market sentiment at the time of debut.

Anil Ambani aide and senior Reliance Power executive arrested by EDThe arrest of Ashok Pal, who serves as the executive director at Reliance Power, is related to a suspected fake bank guarantee racket worth Rs 68.2 crore.

Tata History: When Nehru, Jinnah, and Bose allied to save steel companyStarting as a company trading in cotton and opium, the Tata Group has weathered colonial economic warfare, nationalist politics, labor upheaval, and insurgent crises. But it has always emerged stronger through vision, sacrifice, and resilience. In the final episode of our series on the group, we revisit two storms that threatened to sink the Tata brand and image.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks rally; Cipla, SBI among top gainersSensex ends 328 points higher, Nifty above 25,250; Cipla, SBI lead gains

Convenience or debt trap? The hidden cost of BPNL, easy credit and festive offersEvery festive season, easy credit makes everything—from gadgets to holidays—look affordable. But behind the glitter of BNPL schemes and "no-cost EMIs" lies a growing debt trap that's quietly eroding financial freedom.

Tata Trusts trustee Vijay Singh calls internal rift unprecedented: ReportVijay Singh, who serves as a trustee and vice-chairman of Tata Trusts, said that the act of voting on internal matters went against the long-standing principles followed during Ratan Tata's leadership.

WeWork India slips 5% in debut trade amid valuation, governance concernsCorporate governance firm InGovern warned investors of WeWork India's fragile financials, negative cash flow, high lease liabilities, and the absence of fresh capital infusion.

Buy, borrow, die: The wealth cheat code the rich don't share, explains CAEver wondered how wealthy families keep growing their wealth while others struggle with taxes and inflation? CA reveals a simple three-step strategy: Buy, Borrow, Die. Have a look.

LG Electronics IPO GMP touches Rs 400: Here's how to check allotment statusLG IPO: The GMP is an indicator of market sentiment, showing the expected difference between the IPO price and the likely listing price. With the upper price band set at Rs 1,140, a GMP of Rs 400 suggests the shares could debut at around Rs 1,540, implying potential listing gains of roughly 35%.
TCS reports 20,000 layoffs, employees' advocacy group questions transparencyThe IT giant's employee strength fell from 6,13,069 on June 30 to 5,93,314, according to Q2FY26 data posted on its website.

Stopping PF contributions? What it means for your retirement savingsPausing your PF contributions may seem harmless, but it can slow down your retirement savings. Even if your money stays safe, missing deposits could mean losing valuable interest and tax benefits over time.

What's brewing at Bira 91? Over 250 employees seek removal of founder, says reportEmployees cited "corporate governance failure, lack of transparency, delays in salaries and dues," as well as cases filed by creditors indicating deteriorating financials and pending vendor payments.

Tata Capital IPO vs LG IPO GMP: Which one is likely to give better returns? Tata Capital's IPO, priced between Rs 310–Rs 326, shows modest grey market premiums of Rs 6–Rs 7, indicating limited listing gains. LG Electronics India's IPO, at Rs 1,140, boasts Rs 380 GMP, suggesting strong upside.

Bitcoin slips again. 3 reasons why the crypto market is downBitcoin's price has slipped again this week, signalling renewed volatility in the digital asset space. From rising US inflation worries to ETF outflows, here's what's dragging crypto prices lower.

The legacy of Tata Trusts, beyond the boardroomTata Trusts is one of India's oldest, largest, and most influential philanthropic foundations.  A group of public charitable trusts set up by members of the Tata family, the present-day Trusts trace their origin to the working-class-focused JN Endowment Fund, started by Jamsetji Tata.
Sensex, Nifty trade higher after flat start as banks lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 232.01 points to 82,404.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 70.60 points to 25,252.40 as of 9:32 am.

entertainment.headline: AI-reimagined Mahabharat to premiere on OTT: When and where to watch India's epic Mahabharat is returning in an AI-reimagined version, premiering on WAVES OTT on October 25 and on Doordarshan from November 2. The series uses advanced AI to recreate the story's characters, battlefields, and moral dilemmas with cinematic scale.

From reels to reality: How Guru Randhawa is turning Instagram into talent hunt Instagram Reels are replacing auditions for singer Guru Randhawa's latest projects. Influencer Ahsii, who recently played lead in Pan India, talked to us about how her viral clip landed her on a music video set.

Katy Perry, Justin Trudeau seen kissing on yacht amid dating rumours Popstar Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau were spotted kissing on a yacht in California, seemingly confirming dating rumours. The viral pictures come months after their first public outing in Montreal, ending speculation about their relationship status.

Shah Rukh Khan saves Nitanshi Goel as she trips on stage, video goes viral Nitanshi Goel won the Best Debut Female award at Filmfare 2025 for 'Laapataa Ladies', with Shah Rukh Khan and Karan Johar hosting the ceremony. A heartwarming moment went viral when Nitanshi tripped on stage and Shah Rukh quickly came to her rescue.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Vijay Sethupathi rips apart Kamrudin, VJ Parvathy  Bigg Boss Tamil 9 host Vijay Sethupathi called out contestants for their gameplay and failure to manage the week's tasks, especially targeting Kamrudin and VJ Parvathy. His tough comments left Aurora and Parvathy upset, with Sethupathi advising them to maintain dignity while highlighting areas for improvement.

Diane Keaton dies at 79, Leonardo, Jane Fonda and other Hollywood celebs pay tribute Hollywood legend Diane Keaton, famous for 'Annie Hall' and 'The Godfather', passed away at 79. Celebrities like Leonardo DiCaprio, Jane Fonda, and Michael Douglas paid heartfelt tributes, remembering her iconic performances and unique personality.

The Woman In Cabin 10 review: Keira Knightley's high-seas whodunit hits rough watersRelease Date:Fri Oct 10, 2025 Netflix's latest thriller, 'The Woman in Cabin 10', follows a troubled investigative journalist aboard a luxurious yacht, unravelling a mystery that ultimately feels predictable and lacking in suspense.

Priyanka Chopra captures Nick Jonas helping with her hair, shares adorable video Priyanka Chopra shared an adorable video capturing Nick Jonas helping her with her hair at the airport, giving fans a glimpse of their playful bond.

Deepika Padukone to Allu Arjun: 5 casting controversies in pan-India films From blockbuster expectations to creative clashes, pan-India films bring together stars across industries, but not without their share of controversies, from Deepika Padukone's exits to Allu Arjun's walkouts.

Amitabh Bachchan distributes goodies to fans on his 83rd birthday. Watch Amitabh Bachchan celebrated his 83rd birthday by stepping out to greet fans, breaking his usual Sunday wave tradition, and even distributed goodies to them.

Diane Keaton no more: Priyanka to Kareena, celebs pay tribute to Hollywood icon Hollywood icon Diane Keaton, famous for 'Annie Hall' and 'The Godfather' series, died at 79, with celebrities like Priyanka Chopra, Kareena Kapoor, and Zoya Akhtar paying heartfelt tributes.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 10: Rishab Shetty's film beats Coolie and Saiyaara Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' is unstoppable at the box office, earning Rs 396.65 crore in just 10 days and becoming the third biggest Indian hit of 2025. With strong word-of-mouth and weekend growth, the film is now close to entering the Rs 400 crore club.

Exclusive: Aditya Gadhvi's new Gujarati folk hit Meetha Khaara highlights Agariyas Aditya Gadhvi's new Gujarati folk hit 'Meetha Khaara' highlights salt farmers' struggles in Gujarat. The song continues his mission to showcase underrepresented communities through folk music.

Oscar-winning actor Diane Keaton dies at 79 Oscar-winning actress Diane Keaton, famed for Annie Hall, The Godfather, and The First Wives Club, has died at 79 in California. Her family has requested privacy as they mourn.

Filmfare Awards 2025 winners: Who took home the big trophies? Full list inside 'Laapataa Ladies', starring Pratibha Ranta and Nitanshi Goel, clinched the majority of awards at the 71st Filmfare Awards 2025. The star-studded ceremony is being held in Ahmedabad.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Salman denies favouring Amaal, exposes Tanya Actor Salman Khan addressed allegations of being partial towards singer Amaal Mallik in 'Bigg Boss 19' on Weekend Ka Vaar. He also exposed spiritual influencer Tanya Mittal's game to the rest of the contestants.

PM Modi's passion will boost archery legacy: Ram Charan after meeting Actor Ram Charan and his wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the national capital on Saturday. The meeting focused on the Archery Premier League.

Ram Charan's daring mountain dance for Peddi song goes viral. Watch A video of actor Ram Charan performing a dance sequence on a rocky cliff edge has gone viral. The behind-the-scenes clip is from the sets of his much-awaited film 'Peddi.'

Punjabi folk singer Gurmeet Singh Maan dies due to heart complications Punjabi folk singer Gurmeet Singh Maan, who was also a police officer, has died. Maan's songs often reflected the traditions of rural Punjab.

general news.headline: Snub not intentional: Taliban minister at press meet redo with women journalistsAfter facing sharp criticism for excluding women journalists from a press meet in New Delhi on Friday, visiting Afghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi on Sunday called another, "inclusive" press conference and offered a clarification for the earlier omission.

Shouldn't allow girls out at night: Mamata Banerjee's shocker after gang rapeMamata Banerjee also questioned why her government is singled out every time a rape incident occurs. Referring to an incident nearly a month ago, when a student was gang raped at Odisha's Puri beach, she asked, "What action is being taken by the Odisha government?"

58 Pak soldiers killed in cross-border ops, claim Taliban. Then, a warningSaying that Afghanistan has the right to defend its air and land borders, the Taliban said they had halted overnight operations against Pakistan along the Durand Line at the request of Qatar and Saudi Arabia.

BJP leaders stopped from meeting Bengal gang-rape survivor, spar with copsA group of BJP leaders, including party leader Locket Chatterjee, were stopped from visiting the hospital in West Bengal's Durgapur, where a MBBS student was allegedly gang-raped on the premises two days ago.

Bullets and business: How Gujaratis run killer motel dhandho in USGujaratis own over 60% of motels in the US. But the killing of seven Gujaratis linked to the motel business this year reveals the occupational hazards. Motel owners from the US share how they have managed to run the dhandho successfully despite increasing gun violence and racism.

IND vs AUS Live: Mandhana falls after sublime 80-run inningsINDW vs AUSW, Women's World Cup Live Score: India have lost their first wicket in the 25th over. Smriti Mandhana tries to hit Sophie Molinuex for a six but ends ups handing a catch at deep mid-wicket to Phoeve Litchfield.

Chidambaram calls Op Blue Star a mistake, Congress bristles: Under pressure?P Chidambaram also said the decision to launch Operation Blue Star was a collective one, involving the Army, police, intelligence, and civil service, and could not be blamed solely on Indira Gandhi.

PM Modi gets invite from Egypt's Sisi for Gaza peace meet co-chaired by TrumpWhile Prime Minister Modi will not be attending in person, the Ministry of External Affairs has confirmed that Minister of State Kirti Vardhan Singh will represent India at the high-level summit.

Mount Everest visible from Bihar: Astronaut captures it from spaceThis awe-inspiring perspective comes just as a separate video showing Mount Everest visible from Bihar captured attention across social media, igniting fresh fascination with the world's tallest peak.

Why Tata Trusts is a divided house a year into Ratan Tata's passingThe Tata Trusts edifice that seemed infallible has developed cracks. While the battle is being fought in the boardroom, it has come under the Centre's scanner

Katy Perry, Justin Trudeau seen kissing on yacht amid dating rumoursPopstar Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau were spotted kissing on a yacht in California, seemingly confirming dating rumours. The viral pictures come months after their first public outing in Montreal, ending speculation about their relationship status.

Pakistan fumes over India-Afghan statement, objects to Kashmir mentionPakistan also rejected Taliban leader Amir Khan Muttaqi's claim that terrorism is solely Pakistan's internal problem, insisting that terrorist elements operate from Afghan soil.

Supreme Court wants sex education early in school. But is India even ready?The Supreme Court recently urged starting sex education early in schools, before Class 9. But with deep-rooted taboos, overstretched teachers and uninformed parents, is India even ready to accept or implement it in schools?

Day 3 Live: Campbell, Hope keep India at bayIND vs WI Live score, 2nd Test Day 3: West Indies opener John Campbell and Shai Hope have kept India at bay in Delhi with their massive stand. The hosts are desperate for a breakthrough as Ravindra Jadeja and Kuldeep Yadav are bowling in tandem.

Likely espionage: Nobel institute flags leak before Maria Machado prize revealThe Nobel Institute has flagged unusual betting activity ahead of Maria Corina Machado's Peace Prize win, with officials saying espionage is "highly likely", though no internal leak has been confirmed.

IND vs AUS: Mandhana climbs mount 1000, breaks multiple records in women's ODIsSmriti Mandhana created history as she became the first player in women's ODIs to score 1000 runs in a calendar year. Mandhana reached the landmark during the match against Australia in Vizag.

From teen bride to having Princess Diana as client: The Shahnaz Husain storyFrom marrying at 15 to building a global beauty legacy and even counting Princess Diana as a client, we sit down with Shahnaz Husain to talk motherhood, family, Ayurveda, and giving back, basically, Anything But work.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

3 arrested for medical student's rape near Bengal hospital; hunt on for 2 moreWest Bengal police have arrested three men in connection with the gang-rape of a medical student near the hospital. Two others remain on the run.

Video: Kota man carries 8-foot crocodile on shoulder as officials fail to show upA man in Rajasthan's Kota district carried an eight-foot crocodile on his shoulders after officials allegedly failed to respond to villagers' calls for help.

Why Indians still prefer buying homes during auspicious monthsBuying a home in India is more than just a financial decision — it is an emotional milestone. For many, choosing the right time to invest is as important as picking the right property, with festivals and auspicious dates playing a big role.

How you hold your phone can reveal a lot about your mental healthLooking down at your screens or reading the most interesting book in a slouched manner can actually weigh heavily on your mental health. Science and experts back it up.

Fake news is India's speciality: Yunus denies attacks on Hindus in BangladeshMuhammad Yunus dismissed several international reports of communal violence against Hindus in Bangladesh following the fall of the Sheikh Hasina government last year, calling them "fake news" floated by India.

Kajol wins Internet with 'most epic throwback ever' ft SRKActor Kajol shared a then-and-now picture with her 'Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jayenge' co-star Shah Rukh Khan on Sunday. She celebrated their journey by posting a heartfelt message after receiving her seventh Filmfare award.

Shah Rukh Khan saves Nitanshi Goel as she trips on stage, video goes viralNitanshi Goel won the Best Debut Female award at Filmfare 2025 for 'Laapataa Ladies', with Shah Rukh Khan and Karan Johar hosting the ceremony. A heartwarming moment went viral when Nitanshi tripped on stage and Shah Rukh quickly came to her rescue.

sports.headline: Out of my comfort zone: Former NZ coach Gary Stead ready for Andhra challenge Gary Stead said that the job as the new Andhra coach is out of his comfort zone but is eager for the new challenge. Stead took over as the new Andhra red-ball coach after his tenure with New Zealand came to an end.

IND vs AUS: Mandhana climbs mount 1000, breaks multiple records in women's ODIs Smriti Mandhana created history as she became the first player in women's ODIs to score 1000 runs in a calendar year. Mandhana reached the landmark during the match against Australia in Vizag.

BSF's Kashmir Push: Wular Marathon Draws Thousands for Fitness & Peace This special report focuses on the Wular Marathon, organized by the Border Security Force (BSF) in Bandipora, North Kashmir, to promote physical fitness, environmental awareness, and positive engagement among the youth. 'If I ran, I ran for myself, to maintain my health,' said one national awardee teacher, who passionately urged more women to participate in such events for their well-being. The marathon, held on the banks of Wular Lake, saw hundreds of participants across 5 km, 10 km, and 21 km categories. Speakers like advocate Saika Rashid highlighted the event's positive message, encouraging youth to stay away from drugs and participate in constructive activities. The report also notes this event precedes a larger international Kashmir Marathon organized by the J&K government.

Brian Lara makes hilarious request to Delhi Test hero Yashasvi Jaiswal West Indies legend Brian Lara had fans smiling after the Delhi Test as he made a hilarious request to India's Yashasvi Jaiswal, who tormented Caribbean bowlers with his stunning 175-run knock.

No wildcards for Indians at Chennai Open? Vijay Amritraj's call sparks debate Vijay Amritraj's comments on wildcard entries for Indian players have ignited controversy in Indian tennis. The debate raises questions on opportunities and support for women players ahead of the Chennai Open.

The defeat leaves Bangladesh suffering a 0-2 series-defeat, intensifying pressure ahead of the final match.

INDW vs AUSW: Will Vizag weather play its tricks again in crucial fixture? India vs Australia, Women's World Cup: India play Australia in perhaps the toughest fixture of the tournament. Will the Vizag weather play its tricks again?

Captaincy Magic: How skipper Shubman Gill's transformed into India's run machineIND vs WI: Thrown into the deep end of captaincy, Shubman Gill was given the option to drown or swim. But keeping the element of batting away from his captaincy, the 26-year-old has become a Virat Kohli-esque run machine after being made India skipper.

Brian Lara visits WI dressing room after Day 2 of Delhi Test, talks to captain, coachLegendary Brian Lara visited the West Indies dressing room after Day 2 of the second Test against India, discussing the state of West Indies cricket with coach Darren Sammy and captain Roston Chase. He urged players to play with passion despite financial challenges.

Vizag vibes: Port city prepares for Women's World Cup's first sold-out gameIndia vs Australia: As the Women's ODI World Cup grips Visakhapatnam, the port city's cricketing spirit shines brighter than ever. From passionate local fans to an engaged state cricket body, Vizag is primed and ready for the fully sold-out marquee clash on Super Sunday.

England have a chance to beat Australia in the Ashes this year: Chris WoakesFormer England pacer Chris Woakes, believes England "have a hell of a chance" to end their Ashes drought in Australia this year. He backs Ben Stokes' squad, citing their depth, fearless approach, and experience as key factors for success.

Yashasvi Jaiswal will break Sehwag's 300 record: Mohammed KaifFormer India cricketer Mohammed Kaif hailed Yashasvi Jaiswal's remarkable consistency and hunger for big scores, predicting that the young opener will one day break Virender Sehwag's iconic triple-century record.

Wounded India eye comeback vs mighty Australia in sold-out Vizag showdownDays after a heartbreaking loss to South Africa, a bruised Indian side would like to make a strong comeback when they come up against the unbeaten Australians in a sold-out showdown at Vizag.

We've beaten Australia in the past and will give our best again: Sneh RanaIndia all-rounder Sneh Rana has said that they will take confidence from their previous victories against Australia into their upcoming Women's World Cup 2025 encounter. India are set to take on Australia in their fourth fixture of the Women's World Cup 2025 on Sunday, October 11 in Visakhapatnam.

Watch: Father Naushad follows Sarfaraz Khan, loses 38 kg in stunning transformationInspired by his son Sarfaraz Khan, father Naushad lost 38 kilos in six months. Sarfaraz and his father underwent a lifestyle change as the Mumbai batter started to work on his fitness in a bid to make his way back into the Indian team.

England still not at their best despite big win over Sri Lanka: Nat Sciver-BruntEngland captain Nat Sciver-Brunt scored a record-breaking century to help her team thrash Sri Lanka by 89 runs in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup. Despite the big win, she highlighted the need for stronger partnerships in the middle overs for consistent performances.

One of the most difficult moments in our history: USA cricket on ICC suspensionUSA Cricket has entered a challenging period after its suspension by the ICC and bankruptcy filing, citing a dispute with American Cricket Enterprise and a focus on safeguarding the sport's integrity in the US.

Watch: Fans, dressing room erupt as Namibia stun South Africa in maiden T20I tieNamibia secured an incredible win over South Africa in their first T20I tie against the Proteas on Saturday, October 11. The fans and the Namibian dressing room erupted as Zane Green hit the winning runs.

Brunt, Ecclestone annihilate Sri Lanka as England rise to top with 89-run winNat Sciver-Brunt's century and Sophie Ecclestone's four wickets powered England to an 89-run win over Sri Lanka in the ICC Women's World Cup 2025. Courtesy of their win, they rose to the top of the points table with their third successive win.

India have been a sleeping giant in the women's game for a long time: Alyssa HealyAustralia captain Alyssa Healy called India the sleeping giant of women's cricket and spoke about the impact of the Women's Premier League (WPL) on their game ahead of their fixture in the Women's World Cup 2025 on Sunday, October 12.

Getting Olympics 2036 will be absolutely transformative for India: Carl LewisIn an exclusive chat with India Today, Carl Lewis said that becoming the home of the 2036 Olympics will be transformative for India. Lewis also said that India is just a little infrastructure away from becoming one of the greatest sporting countries in the world.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
